name: Day Divider
description:
A short anti-game tribute to works by Lucy Skaer, shot on 32mm film.
Contains 6 magical spells with acoustic performances by Viktor Kraus.

Like the video installations it was based on, this game is meant to be played continuously. Sit down, make a cup of tea, turn down the lights, and let it calm you down. There's not much interactivity, you're just a witness, but you can use arrow keys to rotate.

Based on the following works:


Created by
Adam Pype
Ward Dheer
Viktor Kraus
